entry.title: Protect the Freaking Ball
entry.content:
I freaking had three episodes of dreams last night but I messed up and didin’t write them down before making breakfast so I only remember one. I’m going to start setting up the tomorrow’s posts so I can just slap them down on the post in the morning.

I’m transferring???

So the only dream I remember involved me getting an email in my Purdue email saying that I’m being transferred to a private local college back home, and I had no choice but to go. When I arrived in my hometown, all my buds from home had been extracted from their respecitve colleges and we were forced to take a placement test. So this isn’t very exciting, but the thing is that I remember the test with such detail. I was doing freaking combinatorics problems, drawing RTL diagrams, writing code, and doing IQ test questions. When I woke up I actually said wtf because at one point I was deriving a formula for a summation on paper, like that’s shit I can’t even do when I’m awake… I’m sure my other dreams were more #action_packed but I had to make breakfast.

It has bread this time

Last cajun suasage. I promise you guys I’ll get a different kind of sausage tomorrow. I had some peanut butter sandwiches today too since I had to skip lunch. I’ll admit I licked the melted peanut butter off my wrists like a savage.

My chuttigabro Utpal

So I had a totally messed up state diagram drawing so when I was creating the controller module I already knew I was fucked. So shoutout to my TA Utpal for drawing this masterpiece of a state transition diagram for me.

Ball is life?

So the team I played with the first couple games today could hardly inbound the ball… We made these guys look like the Golden State Warriors.
Later my asian niggas came and we styled on the opposition so that was good. People at Purdue take too many stop up threes. No one ever wants to run the good ol pick and roll or cut to the rim. But everyone plays with really good effort so the games are still awesome. We’re lucky we have ten courts at our rec center.

Spaghetti Carbonara (not really)

The only Carbonara thing about this pasta was that I used bacon. But I also used the leftover roast pork I had so the porkfat melted in with the bacon fat and then what more can I say. I added some spinach and red onion to make it healthy.
